alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 6:43AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall occurred early Thursday morning. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Bourbon and Crawford. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 641 AM CDT, Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. This replaces the Flash Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburg, Girard, Frontenac, Arma, Mulberry, Arcadia, Walnut, Hepler, Chicopee, Franklin, Farlington, Brazilton, Ringo, Beulah, Polk, Greenbush, Englevale, Pawnee Station, Lone Oak, Hiattville, Croweburg, Yale, Porterville and Opolis. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
